intro: Erythroxylum laetevirens, commonly known as the green leafed copal tree, is a species native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically elliptical in shape. It produces small, greenish-white flowers and red or orange berries that contain the seeds. This species is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in humid, shaded environments.
